Fix Pilot Prompt Templates

Pilot Builder is generally available in Spring ’24. There are some breaking changes if you created pilot prompt templates in Winter ’24.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions with the Einstein for Sales, Einstein for Platform, or Einstein for Service add-on


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create and manage prompt templates in Prompt Builder:	Prompt Template Manager permission set

All prompt templates created for the pilot are invalid in Spring '24. Recreate these pilot prompt templates as new prompt templates in Winter '24. A pilot prompt template has a Category of Pilot and a Status of Unsupported in the All Prompt Templates list.

Recreate a pilot template as a new prompt template.

Click the prompt template name.
Note the Prompt Template Details so that you can recreate a new prompt template with the same values.
Click Copy to Clipboard. Prompt Builder automatically updates the merge syntax from the pilot prompt content to an updated merge field syntax in Spring '24. See Resource Merge Field Syntax After the Pilot.
Click New Prompt Template.
Add the same prompt template details that you had in the pilot prompt template and click Next.
Paste the pilot prompt template text into the Prompt Template Workspace.
If the template has flow or Apex resources, those artifacts need to be recreated. See Flow Changes After the Pilot and Apex Class Changes After the Pilot.
When the new template is tested and ready, activate it to make it available to your users.
In Winter '24, there was no ability to activate or deactivate a prompt template so all templates were effectively activated.
Delete the pilot prompt template.
Resource Merge Field Syntax After the Pilot
The merge field syntax has changed in Spring ’24.
Flow Changes After the Pilot
All pilot flows are invalid in Spring ’24. You must recreate a pilot flow as a Template-Triggered Prompt Flow and use these updated flow requirements.
Apex Class Changes After the Pilot
In Spring ’24, an InvocableMethod annotation must specify a CapabilityType that matches the prompt template type.
